title: miracle baby born 17 weeks
story: Miracle baby born  weeks premature weighed same amount as a tin of beansBonnie Elizabeth Morgans weighed an astonishing Ib oz when she was born  weeks premature on September ,  - and could have been classed as a late miscarriage before doctors recognised a sign of leBonnies mum, Rachel Morgans, , said her daughter broke the record as the youngest gestation to survive at Leighton Hospital in Crewe Image: Rachel Morgans MEN MediaByDavid Houston:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA aposmiracleapos baby was born weighing just Ib oz following her incredible premature birth. Bonnie Elizabeth Morgans weighed an astonishing Ib oz when she was born  weeks premature on September , . Bonnieaposs mum, Rachel Morgans, , said her daughter broke the record as the youngest gestation to survive at Leighton Hospital in Crewe at  weeks and one day.Rachel said the cut off at Leighton Hospital is  weeks, so Bonnie could have been classed as a late miscarriage, but doctors gave Bonnie a chance after she showed a apossign of leapos. Thankfully, Bonnie came home for the first time on January , and her mum has spoken to CheshireLive about her experience. Rachel said: At the end of May , I found out I was pregnant because I thought I had appendicitis, but I never did.Bonnie was a twin, and I had miscarried the twin, so thataposs what the problem was. Bonnie was a suspected ectopic pregnancy, so basically they thought she might have been in the entrance of the fallopian tube.After a few scans, they decided that Bonnie could be a viable pregnancy, so we went ahead with it. Weaposve had quite a bad pregnancy. We had lots of bleeding and stuff like that, mainly due to the miscarriage and all that going on. Then on the th September at . Bonnie arrived in this world after like an hour labour. It was a very short labour. In Leighton Hospital, the cut off is  weeks, so Bonnie would have been classed as a late miscarriage, but the doctors that were on that day, and the midwe, who Bonnieaposs gets her middle name from, decided they would give Bonnie a chance,she showed a sign of le, they would give her a chance.  Bonnie came out and cried. Because she cried they said she showed a fight for le, so they did and pushed for her and sheaposs here today. Rachel said it was a aposreliefapos when she and her husband Adam Morgans heard Bonnie cry, but that their thoughts then turned to what was next for the baby. She said: I just assumed that she would never survive to be honest. Iaposve had a premature baby before at  weeks, my eldest, and I thought that was bad enough when she was born at  weeks. So I think me and my husband, when the labour started, we just assumed that she would never survive and that she would be born stillborn. But when she cried it was a relief, but it was also a bit like aposOK, so what does this mean type of feeling, weaposve got something  to deal with nowapos. Bonnie has such a horrendous time because she was transferred to Arrowe Park Hospital because they canapost look after a baby at Bonnieaposs gestation at Leighton, it needs to have what is called a tertiary care unit.  So she had to go to Arrowe Park. They have kept her alive to this day, but sheaposs had two cardiac arrests, sheaposs had surgery at Liverpool Womenaposs Hospital because sheaposs got whataposs called ROP [retinopathy of prematurity], which is basically from the oxygen that sheaposs needed to survive has damaged her blood vessels in her eyes. So sheaposs had to have laser eye surgery. You name it, this kidaposs had it. Sheaposs had the works. Bonnie came home on Thursday eveningfor the first time since her birth in September. Rachel said: Sheaposs on oxygen at home, but sheaposs on very minimal oxygen. Even though sheaposs like a Ib oz baby, sheaposs very tiny still. She looks like a newborn baby now. Sheaposs got whataposs called chronic lung disease now because she needed such high respiratory support. So sheaposs going to have that probably for the rest of her le, but theyaposre hoping they can get her off oxygen by her first birthday. Up until sheaposs around seven, she will be seen by a lot of neonatal consultants and paediatricians just to make sure that she does meet her milestones andthereaposs anything they can do, they will intervene to help us, but other than that they canapost see why she wouldnapost live a normal le at the minute. Bonnieaposs two older siblings, -year-old Imogen and two-year-old Ralph, were excited to welcome their baby sister home. Rachel added: It was quite a shock to them because we didnapost tell them we were bringing Bonnie home. We just pretended that we were having a meeting at the hospital and we just came home with her. I think everybody was just a bit in shock. Ralph has been so excited. He wants to help do everything. I think for Imogen, because of her age, sheaposs aware of whataposs been happening during our time at Arrowe Park and things, so for her itaposs just a relief that itaposs over and we can all be back together again now because since September we havenapost all been as a family unit. title: more education breastfeeding help new
story: More education on breastfeeding will help new mums who suffer with nipple pain" content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _Mother-breastfeeding-her-baby-son.jpg" width"" "" Breastfeeding levels in this ­country are way below idealImage: Getty ImagesopinionByMiriam Stoppard:,  Jan | commentsBreastfeeding levels in this ­country are way below ideal. No woman should feel coerced into breastfeedingshe doesn’t want to, but I’m in favour of making it as easy as possible for her to breastfeed her baby and for them to bond. One of the greatest deterrents for mums is nipple pain. More than seven out of  of first-time mothers report nipple and or breast pain in the first week after giving birth. And the most common cause is inadequate latching on, as described by medical ­practitioner Lisa H Amir and colleagues. Latching on refers to how the baby takes the breast into their mouth to suck, and unless a new mum is shown how to do this, it’s dficult for her to achieve a good latch.  Many new mums don’t understand that the whole nipple, including a lot of the areola, has to go in the baby’s mouth. If not, the baby ends up “chewing and chomping” on the nipple causing bruising and painful breaks in the skin. It’s excruciating when the baby suckles. No wonder a woman wants to stop. It’s worth notingthe pain is continuous it’s unlikely to be ­inadequate latching.  If nipple pain occurs only with breastfeeding, the diagnosis is more likely to be latching dficulty. Other conditions, however, can cause nipple pain during ­breastfeeding such as surgical scars or nipple piercings. Both very long nipples and “flat” or inverted nipples can be painful too. Conditions of the breast itself may contribute. Fullness and hardness of both breasts may indicate engorgement. Redness might signy a blocked duct mastitis . If swelling and redness is marked, and spreading across the breast chest, it’s cellulitis. With engorgement, both breasts are “full”, tender and tense. A blocked duct or mastitis can cause tenderness in a section of breast that may be swollen and hard. With mastitis, the breast might be inflamed, firm, and lumpy. It’s also possible to have allergic dermatitis caused by using a nipple cream.  There again there are conditions where breast pain, or the perception of breast pain, is unrelated to ­breastfeeding such as fibromyalgia and muscle pain. A baby’s so-called tongue-tie is sometimes quoted as a cause of nipple pain, but it rarely is because it rarely truly exists. This leads to many babies having unnecessary tongue-tie surgery. It’s easy to blame tongue-tie for inadequate latching but it’s rarely the cause and parents shouldn’t use it as an excuse for both nipple pain and poor feeding. Most “tongue-ties” ­disappear as the baby grows. title: my parents named ikea free
story: My parents named me Ikea - they got a free sofa but I got bulliedA new mum and dad were inspired by an advert from the Swedish furniture store so named their newborn baby Ikea, but the youngster grew up and wished theyd chosen something  with her father Bradley." content"https:i-prod.mirror incoming article.ece ALTERNATES n _SWNS_IKEA_NAME_.jpg" width"" "" Jasmine Dagless was originally called Ikea, but she legally changed her name after being bullied Image: Jasmine Dagless   SWNSByJohn BettAudience WriterBen Turner:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A young woman had to change her name as a child because she was being bullied for her real name - as her parents had named her Ikea.Jasmine Dagless, , was named Ikea at birth after her mum saw a TV advert for the Swedish furniture store while pregnant, and she thought it sounded right. But when she grew up, Jasmine was dubbed aposflat packapos by school bullies who would cruelly joke about her unusual name. Eventually, sheaposd had enough of the bullying and legally changed her name after putting up with the insults for decades. What do you think about the name Ikea  Let us know in the comments...Jasmine, who changed her name in , said: I used to get called flat pack quite a lot at primary school. The bullying really shocked me because young children donapost know about Ikea. I legally changed my name when I was in secondary school. Itaposs only legally that I get called Jasmine. My family still call me Ikea, or aposKeaapos for short. Jasmine, an NHS admin assistant, said that her mum agreed to the name change - despite the family enjoying perks from Ikea after her birth.She said: When I was younger my mum got a letter from Ikea that basically said we could get furniture and toys free of charge. I got a few toys and my mum got a sofa. Jasmine has now swapped her middle and first name around, so sheaposs legally called Jasmine Ikea Dagless.  For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. And sheaposs stayed loyal to the store by furnishing her flat with a branded six-drawer commode - and is considering buying a built-in wardrobe from the store. Jasmine, from Norwich, said she is keen to visit her local Ikea on a sentimental trip. I went to Ikea when I was one or two but as an adult Iaposve never been - I really want to go. Her name was changed when she was aged .Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news uk-news new-maps-show-how-covid-"Coronavirus in numbers: A further , cases recordedByDave BurkeSenior News Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Latest maps show how Covid cases have fallen across the UK since Christmas - amid hopes that the Omicron wave has now peaked.In the past seven days, more than , infections have been confirmed by the Department of Health, but this is a % drop compared to the previous week. Maps published at the start of the year show a sea of black as the highly infectious iant tore through the country.  But cases have dropped signicantly in all regions - although infections remain high in parts of Northern England and the Midlands. It comes as the Government announced Plan B measures are being lted and Health Secretary Sajid Javid said the country is moving into the next chapter in the battle with the virus.  The North West, Yorkshire and The Humber and the West Midlands are currently experiencing the highest infection rates. London, which was the epicentre of the Omicron outbreak in the build-up to Christmas, has seen cases drop dramatically, and now only the South West has a lower infection rate. Cases in each region currently stand at:Yorkshire and The Humber - ,. cases per , people West Midlands - ,. cases per , people South West - . cases per , people South East - . cases per , people North West - . cases per , people North East - , cases per , people London - . cases per , people East of England - . cases per , people East Midlands - . cases per , peopleOn January , the Department of Health announced , infections in  hours, but in less than four weeks that has dropped dramatically. Yesterday afternoon the Government said there had been , new cases on Saturday. Last week the Government said it was moving into the next chapter in the battle against Covid.Health Secretary Sajid Javid has said he is optimistic the legal requirement for people in England to self-isolate with Covid can be lted in the coming weeks. Mr Javid said the Government was approaching a decision point and that it would be guided by the data in coming to a judgment.The current legislation is expiring in March unless Parliament decides to renew it. As a Government we have to make a decision on that, he told the BBC Radio  Today programme.We will make it in the next few weeks but it will be guided by the data at the time. From what we are seeing at the moment, from the case numbers, hospitalisations, the direction we are travelling at the moment, I am optimistic but I donapost want to say exactly what will happen in March. But I do want to see a time as soon as we can to remove all remaining rules and restrictions around Covid because we do have to learn to live with this virus in the same way we have learned to live, for example, with the flu. A World Health Organisation chief earlier warned that Europe is only passing the halfway mark of the pandemic - and said Covid should not be likened to flu. The WHO says governments should not suggest to people that the data has suddenly changed or the virus has suddenly got incredibly weak.Dr David Nabarro, the WHOaposs special envoy for Covid-, said that the end was in sight but said that Europe was only passing the halfway mark in a marathon.Asked about remarks that Covid- should be treated like the flu, Dr Nabarro told Sky News: I keep wondering what the people who make these amazing predictions know that I and my colleagues in the World Health Organisation donapost know. You see, what people are seeing from around the world and reporting to the WHO is this is still a very, very dangerous virus, especially for people who have not been vaccinated and whoaposve not been exposed to it before. news uk-news prince-andrew-selling-m-ski-"Prince Andrew: Judge declares Giuffre case will go aheadByChristopher BucktinUnited States Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan Lawyers have questioned the sale of Prince Andrewaposs £ million ski chalet, believing it may have been sold to shield it from his sex abuse accuser. The claim came as US experts cast doubt on reports the Duke of York was looking to offer an early £ million settlement to Virginia Giuffre. Earlier this month, it was revealed Andrew, , had found a buyer for his beloved Swiss retreat, and the purchase was proceeding. Undoubtedly the sale would help fund Andrewaposs mounting legal costs in his civil lawsuit with Ms Giuffre, who has filed a civil sexual abuse case against him in New York. But now, an attorney for Jeffrey Epsteinaposs victims has revealed the deal appears less about paying her off, more about preventing her from claiming on the Dukeaposs assets.  If Virginia gets a judgment against Andrew,this went all the way through to trial and she received a financial judgment in her favour, she could execute on any properties he has, the most likely being his ski chalet, said lawyer Spencer Kuvin. If Andrew had properties in any companion country that would abide by such jurisdiction of the US, she can execute on those properties. Asked whether Ms Giuffre could make a claim on Andrewaposs -room Royal Lodge home in Windsor Park, which he shares with his ex-we, Sarah Ferguson, Mr Kuvin said it could not be ruled but would be very very dficult. A diplomatic conversation would be needed to be had, but I imagine it would be unthinkable that it would come to that, he said. Mr Kuvin warned: If the Queen has transferred any property to him, anywhere throughout the entire world, they could try and execute on that propertysuccessful in foreign courts.  Due to US courts having no jurisdiction over the UK,Ms Giuffre were to win her case, she would need to apply in Europe or Britain to have any damages enforced. Despite Switzerlandaposs famous financial secrecy, the assets and proceeds of an inidual are not protected there under law. Giuffre could execute on the chaletshe obtained a civil attachment order. According to Yves Klein, an asset recovery lawyer from Geneva-based law firm Monfrini Bitton Klein he states Swiss law ensures items and valuables belonging to an accused or to a third party may be frozenit is expected that the items or assets will be used as evidence, will be used as security for procedural costs, monetary penalties, fines or costs, will have to be ed to the persons suffering harm or will have to be forfeited. Mr Kuvin described speculation the Prince was preparing to offer a £million settlement to Ms Giuffre to dismiss her lawsuit as premature.  He added: Any offers or speculation about offers at this point is very premature. My guess is that they fight this as long as they can and only settle at the last minutethey feel they must. Giuffre, , has sued Andrew using New Yorkaposs Child Victims Actthat allowed those abused to sue their attackers. In , lawmakers introduced a look-back window that gave victims of decades-old abuse two years to file civil claims by August , , eventhe statute of limitations had expired. The deadline for claims was later extended due to Covid by then New York Governor Andrew Cuomo. Mum-of-three Ms Giuffre, who lives in western Australia filed the lawsuit on August ,  - just five days before the window closed.  She claims in , she was trafficked by billionaire Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell to have sex with the Duke in London when she was , a minor in US law. Giuffre also alleges she was forced to have sex with the royal at Epsteinaposs home in New York and the US Virgin Islands. The Duke, , absolutely and categorically denies her allegations. She is suing Andrew for unspecied damages, which Mr Kuvin said could easily be in excess of £ millionshe is successful. Most of Andrewaposs wealth has been tied up in his multimillion-pound properties, including the ski chalet he bought eight years ago. Some £ million is accounted for by the Royal Lodge, once the home of the Queenaposs sister, Princess Margaret.  Although it is owned by the Crown Estate, the Duke splashed out a further £. million on its refurbishment when he and his family moved in, so he could expect afor his money. Previously, father-of-two Andrew was given Sunninghill House as a gt when he tied the knot with Fergie in . In , six years after the coupleaposs orce, he put the home up for sale but could not find a buyer for more than five years. The home was purchased in  by Timur Kulibayev, the son-in-law of the former president of Kazakhstan, for £. million, several million over the asking price. The Duke is reportedly still earning money from the Queen after being banned from carrying out royal duties.  However, he has reportedly been stripped of the £, in public funds he received each year that saw the taxpayer hand him millions of pounds over decades. Andrew stepped down from royal duties following his car crash BBC Newsnight interview in November  about his friendship with Epstein. He is reportedly receiving an income from the Duchy of Lancaster - a private estate owned by the Queen consisting of , hectares of land in the UK. It includes assets in Cheshire, Staffordshire, Derbyshire, Lincolnshire, Yorkshire, Lancashire and the Savoy Estate in London. The body earns Her Majesty around £ million a year. However, it is not known how much of this is paid to Andrew.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Prince Andrew, Duke of York" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news princess-eugenies-cheeky-complaint-royal-"Royal Wedding ceremony highlights as Princess Eugenie marriesByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Itaposs hard to believe that itaposs been three years since Princess Eugenie announced we all had another royal wedding to look forward to after getting engaged to Jack Brooksbank.Ten months after posing for their official engagement snaps, the couple tied the knot at St Georgeaposs Chapel in Windsor in front of the royal family, friends and TV crews. It was certainly a day to remember, with a celebrity guest list, a stunning wedding dress and a decent amount of social media ban rule-breaking. The bride and groom couldnapost have looked more in love, beaming throughout the public part of the day - but a lip reader has revealed Eugenie wasnapost entirely happy about one thing her new groom did on the day.  When they were sitting side-by-side in St Georgeaposs Chapel listening to readings, Eugenie jokingly said to her new husband: Why arenapost you holding my hand  The Queenaposs granddaughter took the lead and coached Jack through the day, with a letime of royal experience meaning she knew exactly what the crowds wanted. The lipreader revealed that the royal bride initiated the coupleaposs tentative smooches outside the chapel, saying letaposs kiss in front of the cameras. Jack spoke openly about his nerves ahead of the wedding, telling the Daily Mail: Iaposll need to take a few minutes for myself before the speeches because Iaposm terried. Itaposs very exciting but Iaposm a little bit nervous. He overcame his nerves, however, to whisper beautul words to Princess Eugenie as she approached him at the altar. Experts revealed he said Oh, my heart when he saw his bride, before adding Oh break my heart.  And it wasnapost just Eugenie who made some interesting comments at the wedding, and the Queen left guests stunned with a hilarious joke. Pixie Geldof, who was lucky enough to get an invite, chatted about the celebrations during a podcast with fashion designer Henry Holland, What Were You Thinking  She said: I didn’t meet her but she was walking around saying stuff like, ‘Well, it’s great that I have a house big enough to hold all these guests’. She’s full LOL. She was being funny. She was like, ‘Welcome to my home’. Pixie also explained that she had a rather embarrassing moment during the day, which saw her trip over in front of a group of other guests. She said: I fell over at one point. Stacked it, but not on to the floor. And not drunk – hadn’t drunk. news uk-news queen-gone-private-bolthole-reflect-"The Queen arrives at her Sandringham residenceByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Jan | commentsThe Queen has headed to her private bolthole on the Sandringham estate to reflect after a traumatic  months, a royal expert has said. Yesterday, pictures showed H er Majesty making the emotional pilgrimage from Windsor Castle to Sandringham for a stay at the five-bedroom cottage Wood Farm. The cottage is where the late Prince Philip lived following his retirement from public le and is where the Queen and her beloved husband could relax together. Her trip comes just weeks after the Queen stripped her son Prince Andrew of his military titles and learned grandson Prince Harry was launching a legal battle against her government over his security. And speaking to the Mirror, royal biographer Robert Jobson, author of the book Prince Philip’s Century, explained it has long been a place of retreat for the Queen. He said: The Grade II-listed Wood Farm, located on a secluded part of the Queen’s Sandringham Estate looking out to sea, has long been a bolthole for the Queen and her late husband Prince Philip. It is where the Queen, Philip, and their four children went to relax for more than  years. And, of course, it is where Philip made his retirement home in his twilight years with the Queen’s blessing The Queen was known to cook and even do dishes while she was staying there. Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up. It is now the place Her Majesty, now a widow, has chosen to go for a bit of privacy and reflection after a traumatic  months. With its simple furnishings and open fires, it is a lot less formal than le at Windsor, Buckingham Palace and even Balmoral, although it is spacious enough. When Philip was there, he didn’t stand on ceremony and servants didn’t wear the usual royal unorms.  Prince John, the youngest son of George V and Queen Mary who suffered from severe epilepsy and possibly autism, resided at Wood Farm from  until his death there in  and before Philip moved in, the younger royals too had several times held private parties at Wood Farm.The Queen usually spends the month of January and February at Sandringham - following Christmas - in order to mark the anniversary of her father George VIaposs death.He died at the estate in February  - and this is when the Queen officially became the monarch.  This year marks  years since George VIaposs death and Robert says it will be especially poignant as it is also the first year the Queen will face the milestone since Philipaposs death last April. He added: As has been tradition for many years, The Queen has travelled to her Norfolk estate at Sandringham every Christmas and usually stayed on until after the anniversary of her father King George VI’s death, on  February in  in Sandringham. Again, due to Covid protocols, she had to remain at Windsor Castle since the autumn – where she held muted celebrations with close family, including the Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall. This Ascension Day will officially mark  years as monarch following the untimely death of King at just . There will be no broadcast to the nation, for Her Majesty, who will be  in April, it will be a day in quiet, sombre reflection. Now without Prince Philip by her side, it will be even more poignant. title: scorned woman harassed married ex
story: Scorned woman harassed married ex and his new lover - the concierge at her luxury blockLaura Templar, , sent a barrage of texts and emails to her ex-boyfriend, married dad-of-two Patrick OConnor, and his new lover, Caroline Decleves, who worked as a concierge at Templars flashy apartment block in Shoreditch, LondonLaura Templar, , met her ex Patrick OConnor while he was on a construction job at her flashy Shoreditch apartment blockByCachella SmithRyan FaheyNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A jealous girlfriend who discovered her ex was having an affair with the concierge at her apartment block spent six weeks harassing them, a court has heard. Laura Templar, , sent continuous emails and text messages to married father-of-two Patrick OaposConnor and his lover Caroline Decleves.She also swore at Mr OaposConnor as he headed to his office by Broadgate Tower in Bishopsgate in the City of London, Stratford Magistratesapos Court heard. Mr OaposConnor, a married man, became involved with Templar in March  when he was working as a construction worker at her luxury apartment block in Shoreditch. The affair was on and off for about a year before they split, with Templar later finding out that he had started another affair with Ms Decleves.  Margaret Bankole, prosecuting, said: Patrick OaposConnor is married and has two children. He worked in the same building where the defendant lives. The affair began in March  and lasted for two months. Then the affair was rekindled in March last year and ended the same month, which is when it is said the defendant began harassing him by constantly sending him messages, emails and text messages. She would also send text messages to his private phone number and his work phone number. He, on numerous occasions, told her she was harassing him and to stop messaging him. On one occasion she sent a text message when he dropped his we off at work stating that she knows he just dropped her off. At this point he was unaware how she would have known that. She purchased tickets to a work event he would be attending and he did not make her aware of that event. On  August at am, Patrick OaposConnor saw the defendant as he was walking into his office by Broadgate Tower.  They crossed paths. It is said the defendant shouted at him What are you still doing here  When are you going to f*** off. Youaposre a c***. Templar also shouted and swore at Mr OaposConnor in the street, on some occasions when he was briefing staff outside of work. Mr OaposConnor had an affair with his colleague Caroline Decleves who works as a concierge in the same building the defendant lives. The defendant began to harass her also, constantly sending emails, contacting her on ious numbers and shouting at her on the street. Templar, who works as an underwriter, told Mr OaposConnoraposs we about Miss Decleves and sent photos to him of his family and children. When Templar was interviewed by the police, she explained her behaviour as believing that she was owed answers, the court heard. Mrs Bankole explained: She said she was in shock as she really loved Patrick and she thought he wanted to be with her. She told the police that she asked him nicely to not stand outside where she lives however he continued to do so. She still sees them every day. When they see her they laugh and wave. Miss Decleves now no longer works in the building. Christopher Pickwick, defending, said: Miss Templar works from home quite often, she has had to see both parties on a regular daily basis knowing that they are seeing each other and that Mr OaposConnor had ended the relationship with her. She found it extremely dficult living in those circumstances. No doubtthey werenapost working so close to her she wouldnapost be in court today. Prior to Miss Templar being interviewed by the police the messaging stopped. Miss Templar in her words said aposI stopped of my own accord when I calmed downapos. Templar, of Bowl Court, Shoreditch, admitted two counts of harassment without violence between  July  and  August . She was given a  month conditional discharge along with a  month restraining order. Templar, who wept during the hearing, was also ordered to pay prosecution costs of £. District Judge John Law said: Obviously, it is a very sad day for you, at  years old to be in front of me having previous good character taken away from you by your guilty pleas. This was obviously an unfortunate and badly ended relationship. But you know that you took that too far in terms of what you did by continuing to contact and harass people who didnapost want to talk to you. Iaposm going to deal with this with a conditional discharge - one of the most lenient sentences I can give. title: six year old girl first
story: Six-year-old girl is first child in the world to walk without quadriceps muscles in legsA girl, , from Bathgate, West Lothian, believed to be the first child born with a condition called arthrogryposis meaning she has no quadriceps muscles in herlegs, learns to walkWilliam Green with his six-year-old daughter Arabella, who is believed to be the first child in the world born with no quadriceps muscles in her legs to take her first steps. Image: SWNSBySarah WardKatie L Wilson:,  Jan | commentsA six-year-old girl is believed to be the first child in the world to walk despite being born with no quadriceps muscles in her legs.Arabella Green spent nearly three months in hospital in Poland having had an op which she could not have had on the NHS.The brave schoolgirl was born with arthrogryposis, a rare condition which means her joints fused in position so she canapost bend her limbs or fingers. Medics in the UK said she would never walk and would be wheelchair-bound for le as her condition was so severe - but doctors in the US believed there was hope. Her parents hoped to be able to take her abroad but the costs were ,. But generous donors gted £, to pay for it, in addition to another £, raised. Dad-of-two William Green, , said the schoolgirlaposs achievements were proof the tide could turn at any time, after she took her first steps following an op in Poland. Arabella is taking between  to  steps per day and is only awake for two hours, due to the physical effort of learning to walk. Tragically, her mum Catherine Wood, , took her own le in March  after an uphill struggle to get treatment for her severely disabled daughter. Arabella flew to Poland with dad William, who works as an electrician, on October , and stood up for the first time on December , taking a few steps with the help of a physiotherapist. She took her first steps alone at the Paley European Institute in Warsaw on January , using a walker, and was able to walk to ring a bell on January  - the day they flew home. William said: Sheaposs doing great, sheaposs only been awake for about two hours a day. Sheaposs not walked for six years. Sheaposs not got any quadriceps in her legs, so she is wearing knee, ankle, foot and forceps supports to support her legs. She has to wear them every night and has her legs fully extended. Sheaposs taking between  to  steps at the moment. On February  they will fly back to Poland for intensive physiotherapy sessions for six weeks, putting in two hours a day. William, from Bathgate, West Lothian, added: If Arabella had this done two or three years ago she wouldnapost be going through so much pain. It had to be done before she was six. Her mum Catherine begged the doctors before she died but they said it was impossible. Arabella uses a crocodile walker for getting around and has an electric wheelchair. She is coming on leaps and bounds at school despite the setbacks she has experienced. Only % of her leg muscles work and she has had metal rods inserted into her bones which her dad described as like pencils. William said: We are working on building her confidence. Sheaposs scared of falling. The main thing is since having the op sheaposs been able to stand on her feet. Arabella is the first child in the world to walk without quadriceps muscles, she was also born with no biceps. She walks by using her glutes and abdominal muscles. The condition she has is very rare, weaposve not come across anyone  who has it in Scotland. Sheaposs doing brilliantly at school because the brain is the most important muscle in her body. She finishes all her work, everything she is given. Nobody knows how far she can push herself. The surgery was groundbreaking. She had mm taken out of her legs.When I was driving back to Warsaw in the rental car I was in bits. Sheaposs a strong wee character, Iaposm so proud of her. The op was such a success, seeing her standing and walking has been amazing. We are so grateful to the people who have helped us get here, sheaposs inspired children all around the world. news uk-news ted-bundys-weird-last-words-"Watch the chilling trailer for new Ted Bundy documentary on Amazon PrimeByVerity Sulway:,  Jan | commentsWhat makes someone become a cold-blooded killer  Are they born that way or did something happen in their lives to turn them into a monster In Ted Bundy aposs case, thataposs what scientists were desperate to discover - whether there was a biological indication that made him a depraved murderer who stole the lives of at least  young women in the late s.Bundy was a good-looking, well-spoken law student who even worked on a suicide prevention phone line. So few people suspected he was the one targeting his victims, raping them, killing them and dumping their bodies, often collecting several of their heads as sick trophies and performing sex acts on them after covering them in make-up.In one final sick insult to those he had murdered, he would oftento where he had abandoned the bodies and have sex with their corpses. Getthe newsyou want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. In a further gruesome confession, Bundy even admitted to eating parts of his victimsapos bodies so he could possess them and they would become part of him. The killer claimed he was addicted to murder, saying: You feel their last bit of breath leaving their body. You’re looking into their eyes. A person in that situation is God. Bundy was finally arrested, tried and sentenced to death aged , having confessed to  murders. On January , , the killer refused to eat any of his final meal - a standard-issue steak, eggs, hash browns and toast because he hadnapost picked anything.  He called his mother, Louise Bundy, who wasnapost present at the execution. It’s a circus and we didn’t feel the agony we would go through by going down there would compensate for a few minutes talking to Ted through the glass, she said. And he also felt that way too. Askedhe had any final words, Bundyaposs response was surprising. Hesitating, his voice quavering, he told his attorney Jim Coleman and Methodist minister Fred Lawrence: Jim and Fred, Iaposd like you to give my love to my family and friends.  The LA Times reported: With that, it was time. A last thick strap was pulled across Bundyaposs mouth and chin. The metal skullcap was bolted in place, its heavy black veil falling in front of the condemned manaposs face. Barton gave the go-ahead. An anonymous executioner pushed the button. Two thousand volts surged through the wires. Bundyaposs body tensed and his hands tightened into a clinch. A tiny puff of smoke lted from his right leg. Meanwhile, hundreds of revellers sang, danced and set off fireworks outside the prison, chanting Burn, Bundy, burn and cheering when his body was brought out in a hearse. Eleanor Rose, the mother of one of his victims, Denise Naslund, said: For everything he did to the girls - the bludgeoning, the strangulation, humiliating their bodies, torturing them - I feel that the electric chair is too good for him.  Following his death, scientists were determined to find out what had turned this seemingly upstanding citizen into a monster. Bundyaposs brain was removed and a series of experiments were carried out to determine why he had carried out his horric crimes. Some brain injuries have been linked to criminality by some researchers, and several serial killers have shared similar neurological profiles. Bundy had told the detective who was instrumental in bringing him to justice that when he felt the urge to rape and kill, it was like a chemical tidal wave washing through his brain which he compared to being addicted to drugs. But when scientists examined Bundyaposs brain, it was found to be totally normal, with no legions, injuries or deformities. When he was alive, examinations by experts suggested he may have had a multiple personality disorder, been a sociopath, a narcissist and exhibited poor judgement and manipulative behaviour. Dorothy Otnow Lewis, a professor of psychiatry at the New York University School of Medicine and an authority on violent behaviour, said a prison guard told her Bundy appeared to transform into a dferent person in front of his eyes. He said, aposHe became weird on me.apos He did a metamorphosis, a body and facial change, and he felt there was almost an odour emitting from him, she recalled. He said, aposAlmost a complete change of personality... that was the day I was afraid of him.apos Do you have a story to share  Email webfeatures@trinitymirror Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Ted Bundy" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: toddlers viral infection turned out
story: Toddlers viral infection turned out to be cancer after mum found lump on his stomachDoctors initially suspected Jamie was suffering from a viral infection because his glands were swollen, but he was eventually diagnosed with cancerDoctors initially suspected Jamie was suffering from a viral infection Image: Family handoutByCharlotte Hadfield:,  Jan | commentsThe family of a toddler whose kidney cancer was mistaken for a “viral infection” has shared their experience of being delivered the devastating news. Little Jamie Clarke was rushed to Alder Hey Children’s Hospital earlier this year after his mum, -year-old Ashley Hughes, discovered a lump on the side of his stomach. Doctors initially suspected the two-year-old was suffering from a viral infection because his glands were swollen but he was taken back to the hospital by his dad Jamie, , the following day. Nan Angela Daniels, , from Kensington, said Jamie’s dad noticed this lump again and “wasnapost happy” so he took him back to Alder Hey.They said it was constipation and again it could be his glands,” she told the Liverpool Echo. “Ashley brought Jamie to my house on Sunday and he didnapost look himself. He was very grey and white, he wasnapost sitting properly in his pram and he couldnapost really walk. Angela said Jamieaposs grandad Andrew was also concerned after seeing the lump, so took him back to Alder Hey. After undergoing blood tests, the family was told Jamie had anaemia and he was kept in hospital overnight. The results of further tests revealed the two-year-old had a tumour that was cm by cm in size, as well as polycystic cysts on his kidneys. They didnapost knowit was benign or cancerous at this point,” Angela said. Due to the amount of cysts on his kidneys, she said doctors were concerned that a biopsy could cause them to burst. So on January , he underwent an eight hour operation to remove the tumour and kidney. Doctors told Jamieaposs family the devastating news he had a Wilms tumour - a type of kidney cancer that primarily affects children. Angela said: It was horrible. We always thought the worst. We knew that it was something bad but we didnapost realise how bad it was. He doesnapost understand whataposs going on, I think thataposs the hardest part. Heaposs got a good support network around him he really has. I think Ashley is still in shock and still quite numb. The operation was successful in removing the tumour but Jamie must now undergo six months of chemotherapy and radiotherapy at Alder Hey and the Clatterbridge Cancer Centre in Wirral.Angela has set up aGofundme pagein the hope of raising enough money to take Jamie on a day out or on holiday once he has finished his treatment.She hopes sharing Jamieaposs story will help to raise awareness of cancer in children and encourage others to always go with your gut instinct and not be afraid to go back to the doctorsyou are concerned. In a message on the Gofundme page, Angela said: We thought we would try this to help us give our baby a day he deserves. He is our true super hero and I wish no one will ever have to go through what we all have been through. title: voice mirror pm treated public
story: PM has treated the public with utter contempt - he needs to resignLiar Boris Johnson has nowhere left to hide Image: REX ShutterstockopinionByVoice of the Mirror:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments Liar Boris Johnson has nowhere left to hide now it has emerged that a Covid lockdown law-breaking birthday party was held for him in Downing Street. Even a fibber as shameless as the charlatan in Number  cannot pretend he did not know a gathering with a cake and a rousing chorus of Happy Birthday by  revellers was a party instead of a work event.What more evidence is required by the police, Sue Gray, Conservative MPs, Parliament and the British people to conclude that Johnson broke the law, lied repeatedly when caught and is totally unfit to lead our nation  The Cabinet room bash in June  – held when families could not say goodbye to dying loved ones, funerals were tightly limited and singing widely banned – will be the final straw for many. Johnson has treated the public with utter contempt, every day he is allowed to remain in office adds insult to injury for those he took for fools. If he had any honour the Prime Minister would resign immediately.  Threat to world BY massing troops on Ukraine’s border in Russia and client state Belarus, ­authoritarian nationalist Vladimir Putin is doing far more than sabre rattling. The threat to unleash Europe’s biggest ­invasion since the end of the Second World War is an aggressive attack on freedom and democracy by a despotic leader. Invade Ukraine and the whole world loses as the economic, political as well as military repercussions will be devastating. Engaging Putin may not trigger sustainable peace but exploring every route to avoiding an invasion is better than fighting one off.  Soap stand-off CORONATION Street and Emmerdale are going head-to-head with EastEnders. The clash for viewers between Weatherfield, The Woolpack and Walford will ide the legion of fans who watch the three soaps. Stakes are high and may the best show win. title: witness claims madeleine mccann suspect
story: Witness claims Madeleine McCann suspect was with her before and after disappearanceThe German witness, who was living in Portugal in , believes Christian Brueckner was miles away from Praia da Luz in Portugal on the day Madeleine McCann went missing from a resort thereChristian Brueckner, the prime suspect Image: REX ShutterstockByMartin FrickerNews ReporterDanya BazaraaSenior News Reporter:,  Jan A new witness has come forward in the case of missing Madeleine McCann claiming to have been with the prime suspect just before and after she disappeared, it is reported. The new witness reportedly insists Christian Brueckner was calm while she was with him and says they were stopped by police who reported no suspicious activity. The German witness, who was living in Portugal in , believes Brueckner was miles away from Praia da Luz in Portugal on the day Madeleine went missing from a resort there. A source told the Sun: She says she was not with him the day Madel­eine disappeared but spoke with him and again said he seemed normal. The source said: This ­testimony could be an issue.  This comes just days after German journalists who were investigating the case claimed they have uncovered “shocking” evidence which “heavily incriminates” Brueckner. British youngster Madeleine was just three-years-old when she vanished from her parents’ holiday apartment in Portugal in . German prosecutors claim to have evidence she is dead and named convicted paedophile Christian Brueckner as their only suspect. Despite going public with the information in June , they have still not charged him with any offence.  But now a team working for TV channel Sat. have handed the evidence to detectives probing Brueckner over the infamous case. Sat. investigators claim to have found fresh evidence linking Brueckner, who denies any involvement, to the crime. They will reveal more information about their investigation in a prime-time documentary, which is yet to have an air date. Announcing the show, Sat. said journalist Jutta Rabe and a team of reporters gathered new information about Brueckner. They claim it includes proof he was near Praia da Luz when Madeleine vanished while her parents dined in a tapas restaurant. The channel said they collected “many new clues and indications” that corroborate the suspicions of German prosecutors.Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON Christian BMadeleine MccannMissing persons" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news young-couple-follow-dream-become-"Jowan Bobin and Minnie Gregory on Castle Brea FarmByJohn BettAudience WriterOlivier Vergnault:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A young couple who love animals have followed their dream and become farmers - despite having no previous experience. Jowan Bobin and Minnie Gregory arenapost like most -year-olds, as instead of going to college or getting an apprenticeship, they decided to become farmers, as Cornwall Live reports.Last year they started managing Castle Brea Farm, near Penzance, Cornwall, even though neither of them had worked in that industry before - although Jowan had thankfully completed a course on the subject. The pair are mainly learning as they go but donapost regret a thing, as Jowan said: I can’t remember ever wanting to do anything .” What do you think to the young coupleaposs farm  Let us know in the comments... Neither Jowan or Minnie are from a farming background but for Jowan, looking after animals is something he has been doing since he was a child.He said: I was  when I took over my parentaposs patch of land and got my first animal. At first it was chickens. I used to sell eggs by the side of the road. Then I had one sheep. I have been building up my collection of animals since I guess. I have always wanted to look after animals.  Jowan, who did a farming course in Exeter prior to taking on the farm, started helping out in a local dairy as a -year-old and would go to the Royal Cornwall Show every year, talking to local farmers and breeders and looking at the animals. My mum is a dentist, Jowan added. And my dad is an extreme sport coach so nothing to do with farming at all. But they have been so supportive. Minnie’s only contact with farm animals came after meeting Jowan but to her own admission, she has no regrets. I was very much into my sports, she said. I am a crossfit trainer. I don’t come from any farming background either. My mum is a nursery teacher and my dad has his own ice-cream van business but I met Jowan and he’s the one who got me into this.  It can be hard at times. Especially on days when it rains all day. But it’s so rewarding too. The young couple raise rare breed goats, sheep, and guinea pigs, alonside a rare breed owl, finches and doves. They have a flock of Boreray Blackface or Hebridean Blackface, which is a breed of sheep originating on the St Kilda archipelago off the west coast of Scotland - the rarest breed of sheep in the UK with only about  breeding ewes known to exist. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newslettershere. Jowan continued: We had  sheep last year but we sold quite a few as it became too much. Now we only have  rare breed Boreray sheep. Elvis is our golden Guernsey goat but we’re looking to get some more this year. We have some dairy goats and our two saddleback cross pietrain sows and our Oxford Sandy and Black pig. It’s probably the second rarest breed of pigs in the world. For us it’s not about having thousands of animals. It’s about focusing on fewer but rarer breed animals. Jowan is a member of the Rare Breeds Survival Trust, a conservation charity whose purpose is to ensure the continued existence and viability of Britain’s native farm animals. He added: For us, it’s about conservation grazing and managing the land in a more sustainable and natural way.Do you have a story to share  Weaposd love to hear all about it. news uk-news you-should-never-leave-your-"What to do in the event of a fireByCourtney PochinSenior Audience Writer:,  Feb Updated:,  Jan | commentsA firefighter has issued a stark plea to parents that may help to save the lives of their children. And the trick to doing it is so simple, but is something many parents donapost do as their children might not like it. In a message posted to the Cold Spring Harbor Fire DepartmentFacebook page an emergency responder revealed how shutting a childaposs bedroom door can make all the dference in the event of a house fire. The unnamed firefighter, who is a parent themselves, wrote: As a parent itaposs hard to convince little kids to sleep with the door closed, they always want it open just a little.  I do a lot of fire prevention at schools, so one thing I try and stress to kids is, how important it is to sleep with the doors closed. They go on to explain how there was recently a fire in a neighbouring area and share photos from the blaze - one showing a blackened, charred door, the other showing the back of the door which is still white. The homeowners and family dog are all doing well, they continue. The photos below are a great example of the importance of keeping bedroom doors closed while sleeping. The door pictured in both photos is a hollow core door to a bedroom. While the front of the door is severely damaged the closed door protected the bedroom and its contents. If this were an occupied bedroom the closed door could have saved a le. They added: The cause and origin of the fire are under investigation and believed to be accidental in nature. The post went viral at the time with over , shares more than , likes and hundreds of comments. Many were surprised to learn of the benefits of having a closed door. One person wrote: I close my door so the ghosts donapost come in my room but glad to know there are other benefits! A second said: This is important info, generally unrecognised. A dferent user asked what would happena fire were to start in a bedroom, to which the fire department responded that they should have smoke detectors installed in all common areas in the house - including bedrooms. title: i gifted pal winning scratch
story: I gted my pal a winning scratch card - husband is demanding some of the moneyA woman has been left feeling torn after her husband kicked off when her friend won money on a scratch card they gted her - as he thinks they deserve some of the winningsThe woman has been left torn over what to do about the gt Image: Getty Images Mint Images RFByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A woman has landed herself in a dficult situation with her best pal and husband over a winning scratch card. Itaposs an awkward situation that no one wants to find themselves in, but one Mumsnet user revealed it all started over a birthday gt.In a post on the online forum, she began: I always buy a £ scratch card to put in peopleaposs birthday cards. Iaposve been doing this for over a decade. The woman, whose identity is unknown, continued: Last month a good friend won a decent four-figure sum on the scratch card I put in their card.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.She shared her excitement for her pal, but revealed it turned sour when her husband told her she should ask her friend for half of the money, as she purchased the card for them. The user continued: My husband thinks I should ask for half of it because I bought it for them. But in my opinion, I bought the scratch card as a gt and in doing so was opening myself up to the possibility of them winning a lot of money.  If I hadnapost been buying it as a gt I wouldnapost have bought the scratch card so itaposs not like I bought a roll of  and gave them the winning one. My husband and I never argue but heaposs really pushing me to ask on this one. We arenapost rich but we also arenapost struggling so I donapost know why heaposs so insistent that I ask for some of it. Weighing up her options, she added: If it was me I would offer half to the person who bought me the card, but this is because Iaposm fairly financially stable and I donapost know the financial status of this friend but Iaposd suspect its not as good as ours. So am I being unreasonable to just celebrate the win with my friend and not ask her for some of the money  She did say when she told me sheaposd won Weaposll have to go put for a meal, babysitter and dinner on us which I personally thought was lovely. In the comments section of the website, people were backing the woman. I wouldnapost ask, for all the reasons youaposve listed, one person shared. Another wrote: Your husband is crazy. You canapost possibly ask her for half of the money. A third penned: You can’t ask. The scratch card wasn’t the gt, the potential prize was and you can’t ask for half of a gt back. Your husband is a tight b*****d. Begrudging someoneaposs birthday present. Is he normally this mean  a fourth furiously asked. She responded to the anonymous writer: See this is the thing. Heaposs normally not at all! He went to private schoolbut we are nowhere near in that situation for our kids. I really donapost know what he is thinking Iaposve tried to ask why heaposs so upset about it, but he just keeps saying she should at least offer. Heaposd trusted his friend to do the inking, as he was a tattoo artist, but somehow he managed to misspell the word aposstayapos, and it came out apossiayapos,A video of the freshly finished tattoo has been shared on TikTok, on the account @suckytattoos, and it shows the tattoo artist trying to hold in his laughter after realising his mistake.What do you think of the tattoo failure  Let us know in the comments...The video was initially shared on Snapchat and in the clip the man can be heard shouting: I trusted you! title: man tinder slammed potential match
story: Man on Tinder slammed by potential match after making clueless joke about ageA man using Tinder has been branded clueless and has been mocked by people online after a potential match on the app shared a look at an immature joke he made to a woman about her ageThe joke backfired on the man as he was mocked onlineImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A man using dating app Tinder has been mocked by people on the internet after he made an immature joke to a potential match.The unknown man connected with a woman who had celebrated her birthday the day before they matched - and he made a distasteful joke about her age - which backfired on him.Taking to Reddit, he shared a screenshot of their conversation, asking othershe had been a douche or did she blow up at me for no reason.The snippets shared online saw a message from him asking: What are you now  right  The woman says: Yepp, as of yesterday.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.He responded: Another year closer to those senior citizen discounts. The woman didnapost find his comment funny, penning back: You can use this as a learning opportunity. I am completely secure in my age but saying that sort of thing to ANY woman will not go well. By saying it, I realise you may be too immature for me. Thank you and have a great night. He didnapost let the conversation stop there, and went back for more. You don’t like jokes  he questioned.  The man added: aposI am completely secure in my age!’ Proceeds to have complete meltdown over age joke. Yea I’m pretty sure that means you aren’t secure and there’s some insecurities there. Anyone  would play that joke off and get me back with something funny but you nearly had a breakdown. He added in his Reddit post that the woman didnapost respond after he replied to her. Other users slammed the man for lacking basic social skills, as they didnapost find his remarks funny either. All you had to do was say happy birthday, one person told him. A second penned: Hilarious you say she had a meltdown as you behave the exact same way. A third said: She literally told you it was her birthday and instead of saying ‘happy birthday’ or ‘did you get any cool gts’ you made a rude joke about her age. Another urged the man to be nice as they wrote: That’s the type of joke you make when you’re dating and super comfortable around one another. Be nice and tell her she looks gorgeous or do the ole ‘damn I honestly thought you were ’. Nothing beats knocking a few years off her age … she will love you after that. Try being nice. It goes a long way.What do you think  Let us know in the comments below.Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON TinderDatingViral" data-immediate"data-immediate" to FREE email alerts with news to brighten your daySubscribeInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum left feeling irritated message
story: Mum left feeling irritated by message on child-free wedding invite from friendA mum was left irritated by an invite which gave parents the golden opportunity for a child-free night, as she claimed the bride and groom dressed it up as a favourMum left feeling irritated by message on child-free wedding inviteImage: Getty Images iStockphotoByBrogan-Leigh HurstShowbiz Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | comments A doting mum was left mildly irritated by a child-free wedding invite as she disliked the wording. Whilst Mumsnet user JukEki was thrilled to be invited along to two weddings in June, she couldnapost help but disagree with how the message had been sugar-coated to seem like it is a night off from childcare for parents.Taking to the website, she created a thread which was titled, aposTo be irritated by this wedding invite apos and ranted to anonymous users online. She began: We have been invited to two child-free weddings, both in June. We are going to attend both and are pulling in favours for childcare.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox. for a Mirror newsletter here.However I can’t pretend that I’m not mildly irritated by the wording in one of the invites! Detailing what both invites said, she continued: One invite said, aposUnfortunately bearing in mind we have limited guest numbers we cannot accommodate everyone’s children however this is a golden opportunity for parents to enjoy a night of relaxation and uninhibited revelry!apos The second simply said, aposWhilst we love your children please note this is an adult-only occasion. But it was the first invite that didnapost sit right with the mum, who went on to list of her reasons for frustration.  She added to her post: The first annoyed me as actually it’s not going to be relaxing for me in the slightest, it’s quite inconvenient and expensive to not be able to bring the children and I’m more likely to be hand expressing in the toilets than dancing on a table. It is absolutely the couple’s prerogative to have the wedding they want including making a decision to have no children - just own it and say so instead of dancing around it and pretending it’s a night off for me. She concluded: Happy to be told I’m unreasonable - first also contained a money poem which may be biasing me. Thankfully, other users agreed with her and agreed that there was no need for the bride and groom to dress up the invite as a favour. One person commented: I agree with you. I hate it when they try to pass it off as doing the guests a favour. Itaposs a nuisance and an expense sorting childcare. I think the second wording is much better. Iaposm all for child-free weddings, but as you say, just be frank about and donapost dress it up as a favour. Another shared: Not unreasonable at all, and yes the appropriate response is ‘irritated’.They are trying to put a positive spin on their decision, but it comes across as patronising. It’s also the babysitter that is allowing you to be child-free for a night, not the wedding. However, it sounds as though it is well-meant and they just haven’t had the opportunity to know what they are talking about.It’s also one of those things people say at this kind of event when they have young children “oh it’s great to have a night off”. It’s true, and it’s a polite thing to say, but it glosses over the effort involved. They have probably heard this before and taken it completely at face value.A third concluded: Agree with you. For us, we like to spend weekends with our children, have no local childcare and I would pass on the “golden opportunity” to pay £ for childcare to attend someone’s wedding. I am from a country where I have never heard of or been to a child-free wedding. Children are accepted as part of le and families.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. title: baby turns blue after dad
story: Baby turns blue after dad took Covid advice from conspiracy theorists onlineInstead of turning to medical professionals, the dad asked an online conspiracy theory group for health advice after his daughter likely caught covidA father from the US gave his daughter a medication meant for head lice, when he was worried she had Covid Image: Getty Images Cavan Images RFByKieren WilliamsNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments A baby turned blue after her dad took Covid health advice from a conspiracy theory online group.Jason became concerned when his six-month-old daughter Ruby began experiencing flu-like symptoms a week after her mother had tested positive for Covid. Instead of taking her to a hospital or doctor, Jason consulted a QAnon Telegram group chat with tens of thousands of people who think Covid is a hoax. Vice reported the conversation that followed.Jason wrote in the group: “Do you guys think it’s safe to give ivermectin to an infant ”Ivermectin is an antiparasitic medicine used to treat infestations in humans including head lice.  Two years ago researchers claimed it could kill off the virus which causes Covid, but there is no clinical evidence to support this and it is widely accepted amongst medical professionals that it should not be taken. The group however, was not medical professionals and they had spent months sharing tips on how best to obtain the drug. One group member responded: “Baby aspirin to thin the blood a little and drop any fever and I would put some ivermectin on the bottoms of her feet,”  Other conspiracy theorists on the chat said he should wait to take advice from “experts” in ivermectin, in the group. One so-called ‘expert’ called Katie said: “From what I understand, yes it is safe to give to an infant, however please stop calling it Covid, it’s not Covid, it’s a simple cold. That’s how we got in this mess to begin with.” Jason took the advice and gave his baby a dose of ivermectin. “We gave her two doses of ivermectin at mg each. That’s what was recommended by someone on here. She got really sick after that. Related  I don’t know.” Jason said. Within minutes Jason said that his little girl’s condition was worsening. He said: “Baby threw up. Is that common side effect  She’s also turning a tad blue.” Someone  said this exact thing had happened to their child, and that they then took their child to hospital.Jason said: “We don’t trust hospitals. I told my son to give her more ivermectin.”Group members begged Jason to take his daughter to hospital. One member called Barbara said: “That baby needs to go to the ER. Do not hesitate. “I’ve seen too many go south due to O levels being low. The blue is hypoxia and that’s lack of oxygen at the tissue level. Please!”  Jason eventually told the group he had taken his child to hospital. “[My] son is taking baby to urgent care. Against my wishes but I’m praying for her. It’s in God’s hands now.” He later said she was “doing better”. He added: “God knew what to do even though I thought hospital was certain death. Thanks for everyone’s advice.” The Mirroraposs newsletter brings you the latest news, exciting showbiz and TV stories, sport updates and essential political information.The newsletter is emailed out first thing every morning, at noon and every evening. Never miss a moment by signing up to our newsletter here.  The US isn’t the only place where conspiracy theorists have been trying to get ahold of the drug. In Australia, the Therapeutics Goods Administrationhas placed restrictions on the prescribing of oral ivermectin amid a spike in demand.The TGA said: “These changes have been introduced because of concerns with the prescribing of oral ivermectin for the claimed prevention or treatment of Covid-.“Ivermectin is not approved for use in Covid- in Australia or in other developed countries, and its use by the general public for Covid- is currently strongly discouraged by the National COVID Clinical Evidence Taskforce, the World Health Organisation and the US Food and Drug Administration.” “Firstly, there are a number of signicant public health risks associated with taking ivermectin in an attempt to prevent Covid- infection rather than getting vaccinated,” it said. “Iniduals who believe that they are protected from infection by taking ivermectin may choose not to get tested or to seek medical carethey experience symptoms. Doing so has the potential to spread the risk of Covid- infection throughout the community. “Secondly, the doses of ivermectin that are being advocated for use in unreliable social media posts and other sources for Covid- are signicantly higher than those approved and found safe for scabies or parasite treatment. “These higher doses can be associated with serious adverse effects, including severe nausea, vomiting, dizziness, neurological effects such as dizziness, seizures and coma. “Finally, there has been a --fold increased dispensing of ivermectin prescriptions in recent months, leading to national and local shortages for those who need the medicine for scabies and parasite infections. “It is believed that this is due to recent prescribing and dispensing for unapproved uses, such as Covid-. Such shortages can disproportionately impact vulnerable people, including those in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander communities.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON World Health OrganisationERBabiesHospitalsCoronavirus" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily coronavirus briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: brit couple face nervous wait
story: Brit couple face nervous wait for surrogate babys passports amid Ukraine tensionsBen and Alice Garratt, who moved from London to Kyiv, Ukraine, in December, said the wait to get their son Raphaels paperwork completed is "more nerve-racking" as embassy staff flee amid fears of a Russian invasionBen Garratt and his month-old baby, Raphael Image: PAByLily FordRyan MerrieldReporter:,  Jan | comments A British couple living in Ukraine while their surrogate-born baby is issued a passport have described their nerve-racking wait amid mounting tensions between Russia and Ukraine. The threat of a Russian invasion has put Nato forces on standby and led the Foreign Office to begin withdrawing some staff and dependents from the embassy in Kyiv - where some British expats said they have bags packed ready to go west.Ben Garratt and his we, Alice, live in Queenaposs Park in London but moved to the Ukrainian capital at the end of the December to meet their baby and oversee official paperwork. Ukraine has very dferent surrogacy laws to the UK which means that itaposs much easier to work with an IVF clinic and a surrogacy agency here to have a baby that way... so Ukraine is an international hub of people coming for surrogacy services, Mr Garratt, , said. Weaposve always known that it would be a load of paperwork once he was born, for us to bring him home - but obviously, what was going to be a period of potential boredom, waiting in an apartment in Kyiv for two or three months, is now more nerve-racking. Unless we can get a passport for Raphael in the conventional way, orthat becomes impossible, the British Embassy get to the point they can give Raphael an emergency passport, we canapost leave - so it is nerve-racking.  Thanks to the process of getting a passport for new-born Raphael, the couple were always planning to be in Kyiv until mid-March. Despite international concerns of impending conflict between Ukraine and Russia, Mr Garratt, who works in stakeholder engagement at London North Eastern Railway, said Kyiv feels completely normal. Itaposs really strange...like Oxford Street on a Saturday... except for the snow, he said. It looks normal. Looking out the window... itaposs buzzing... thereaposs no evidence of panic buying, thereaposs no queues anywhere.  Iaposve never been in a country thataposs been invaded, I donapost know what that feels like, but it feels bizarre that it could happen . He and his we continue to keep in contact with friends and family who are nervous on their behalf. Weaposre nervous on their behalf, weaposre nervous because theyaposre nervous... thereaposs a lot of nervousness spreading through the family, he said. I guess there is a point at which we think, well, aposletaposs just go and seewe can cross a border and get to the UKapos... I donapost think weaposre anywhere near that and Iaposd be really surprised, Iaposd hope the British government wouldnapost let it get to that stage.  Jez Myers, a business consultant who has split his time between Manchester and Kyiv since , said while he is planning toto the city in mid-February, the major concern for many is the possibility of a cyber-attack. If a cyber attack happens, yougot to be concerned about heating, electricity, and cash, the -year-old said. Finding somewhere you can escape to, so: bag packed, clothing, water, chargers, grab your bag and get west...the mantra that most people are adopting. But news of embassy staff leaving is not a concern for Mr Myers.  Itaposs taking precautionary measures... my plan is toin middle of February as scheduled, he said. An IT director from Glasgow said has no intention of leaving his we and son in Ukraine as he maintains all is well. If the tanks roll and they are on the streets, that will bepain...I have no intention of leaving the flat we bought here, George, who has lived in Ukraine for more than two years and did not wish to have his second name included, told PA.are just being cautious... we live normally in Kyiv for now. news world-news crazed-wild-monkeys-filmed-vandalising-"Monkeys vandalise cars outside Buddhist temple in ThailandByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Jan | comments This is the unbelievable moment crazed wild monkeys vandalised touristsapos cars that were parked outside a Buddhist temple. The troop of more than  primates were seen climbing over the vehicles, which were parked opposite the historical San Phra Kan shrine in Lopburi province in Thailand on January .Incredible footage shows the Simians dragging, biting, and ripping the rubber trim off of a pickup truck in an attempt to access the vehicle. Then another group of monkeys were seen trying to break into a black sedan that was parked next to it. Staff say that holidaymakers who leave their cars unattended are at risk of having the vehicles damaged.  These primates are known to swarm the vehicles - which may be rental cars - within minutes.Tourists are advised to park their cars further away. They are also meant to contact the local staffthe animals are stopping them from driving away.Panot Bunsi, one of the drivers whose car was damaged, claims there are now warnings about the wild animals.  The annoyed tourist said: I knew the monkeys pester people for food but I didnapost know they also attack cars. If someone told me before ofthere were warning signs, I would not have left my car. In March , the monkeys had an astonishing mass brawl over scraps of food. In February , dozens of monkeys took over a schoolaposs swimming pool and rummaged through the bins in search of food. Residents believe the monkeys brings good luck to the city.  Many of the monkeys congregate around an ancient Buddhist temple, but they have also taken over a cinema - forcing the previous owner to move out and close the business. Government officials have tried to control the monkey population without success.In , large numbers of monkeys were sterilised after their numbers spiralled out of control during the coronavirus lockdown, with well-meaning locals feeding them sugary drinks.Environmental officer Narongporn Daudduem said the department has a long-term plan to build a sanctuary in another part of the city, but plans are likely to be met with resistance from some of the residents who donapost want the monkeys living near them. title: man left hungry after delivery
story: Man left hungry after delivery driver ate meal and left nasty note when he didnt tipMykul Myas said he waited  minutes for his Mexican food to arrive but instead of getting his meal he was met with an empty bowl and a nasty noteMykul Myas says he was left a note instead of his food Image: Mykul Myas   CATERS NEWSByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Jan Updated:,  Jan | commentsA man claims he was left hungry after his food delivery driver allegedly ate his meal then left him a nasty note after he didn’t leave a tip. Mykul Myas said decided to order in some Mexican food so he could enjoy his cravings in the comfort of his own home. The -year-old from Baltimore, Maryland, USA, said he waited  minutes for his £. burrito bowl, but after going to eat his meal, he was shocked at what he found. Mykul claims his dinner had been completely polished off by the driver, who also left a nasty note stating that he had eaten his food because he did not receive a tip. The carpenter said: “I had a craving for Mexican food and I didn’t really want to go out and get it. “I decided to get it delivered. I ordered a burrito bowl and waited about  minutes.  “I then got a notication saying it was at my door, so I went to check and the bag had just been left there. “I didn’t actually see the person. I was planning to give him a tip in cash, but he drove away before I’d even had a chance. “I couldn’t believe it when I opened the box up to eat my food, and it was all gone. I was in total disbelief, and then to see that note there, it felt really personal. I honestly thought it was someone pulling my leg. I was disappointed, as I was really looking forward to the meal. I ended up just having some ramen noodles after that.” The anonymous note was left in the eaten bowl and read: “Leave a tip next time and this might not happen. “And don’t bother tryna [sic] get me fired. Going back to Amazon.” Shocked Mykul said he could not believe what had happened, adding that he had put some cash aside to give the driver a tip, but they had driven away before he got a chance.Mykul says he has also received an influx of cruel hate comments from strangers around the world after posting the photograph to Facebook, where it has since gone viral.He said: “I’m guessing the driver was just angry about me not leaving a tip in the app, so they decided to eat my food and leave that note. “After reading people’s comments, they were telling me that most delivery drivers make their money off tips. But I had no idea. “I was getting a lot of hate comments about not leaving a tip through the app. ButI had seen the person, I would have given them a cash tip, that was my plan. “People were telling me I got what I deserved and that I’m disgusting. Random strangers have been flooding my inbox with angry messages. “Half the people were laughing that it happened, and the other half were angry.” Read MoreRead MoreMost Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Food" data-immediate"data-immediate"Serve the food you really want to eat by signing up for our tips and recipes and never be bored by your cooking againSign UpInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you.
